Web API Confluence

This site is a work in progress intended for browser engineers to locate low-level differences in support for APIs and to coordinate work. Data reported on the site may not be an accurate reflection of web platform implementations. Please refer to known issues on GitHub for more information.

The Catalog

The API Catalog lists properties and methods exposed on constructor functions and their prototypes. These data are gathered from the JavaScript object graph exposed on major browser releases from the past several years. The catalog constitutes the raw data from which aggregate API Confluence metrics are computed.

open catalog

The Metrics

API confluence metrics are just counts of "APIs" for a particular browser version. By "API" is meant a property or method on an interface exposed by the browser. Examples include:

Window.location
Document.write()
RTCPeerConnection.currentRemoteDescription

Most metrics attempt to capture a count of bad APIs. For example, the Failure to Ship metric counts APIs that a browser release is missing, and all other browsers have been providing the API for at least a year.

A precise definition of the metrics can be found here.

open metrics
Status in standards is not part of the data or analysis, and there is no guarantee that a widely-supported API is interoperable in its details, or will remain part of the web platform.
